str2: Not, lest. A primary particle of qualified negation; not, lest; also (whereas ou expects an affirmative one) whether.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Passive - 2nd Person Singular
str2: A primary verb; to convince; by analogy, to pacify or conciliate; reflexively or passively, to assent, to rely.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative 2nd Person Singular
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
For. A primary particle; properly, assigning a reason.
Or neuter pleion, or pleon comparative of polus; more in quantity, number, or quality; also the major portion.
Forty. The decade of tessares; forty.
A male human being; a man, husband. A primary word; a man.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To lie in wait (ambush) for, seek to entrap (hence: I defraud, deceive). From enedra; to lurk, i.e. plot assassination.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: Whosoever, whichsoever, whatsoever.

word: have bound themselves with an oath
parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To curse, invoke curses, devote to destruction. From anathema; to declare or vow under penalty of execration.
Nor, neither, not even, neither?nor. From me and te; not too, i.e. neither or nor; also, not even.
A primary verb; to eat.
Nor, neither, not even, neither?nor. From me and te; not too, i.e. neither or nor; also, not even.
To drink, imbibe. A prolonged form of pio, which poo occurs only as an alternate in certain tenses; to imbibe.
A conjunction, preposition and adverb of continuance, until.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: From ana and haireomai; to take up, i.e. Adopt; by implication, to take away, i.e. Abolish, murder.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
Ready, prepared. From an old noun heteos; adjusted, i.e. Ready.
A primary particle of present time; 'now'; also as noun or adjective present or immediate.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: From pros and dechomai; to admit (figuratively) endurance); by implication, to await.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Singular
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
A promise. From epaggello; an announcement.
